content: Memorial in Empress Place, Singapore 1°17′14.7″N 103°51′08″E﻿ / ﻿1.287417°N 103.85222°E﻿ / 1.287417; 103.85222 The **Dalhousie Obelisk** is a [memorial](/wiki/Memorial) [obelisk](/wiki/Obelisk) in the Civic District of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), located on the north [bank](/wiki/Bank_(geography)) of the [Singapore River](/wiki/Singapore_River) in the [Downtown Core](/wiki/Downtown_Core), within the [Central Area](/wiki/Central_Area,_Singapore) in Singapore's [central business district](/wiki/Central_business_district). The memorial is erected to commemorate the visit of [James Broun-Ramsay](/wiki/James_Broun-Ramsay), 1st Marquis of Dalhousie to Singapore in 1850. The obelisk is situated at [Empress Place](/wiki/Empress_Place_Building), near the [Asian Civilisations Museum](/wiki/Asian_Civilisations_Museum) and the [Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall](/wiki/Victoria_Theatre_and_Concert_Hall), and the [Anderson Bridge](/wiki/Anderson_Bridge_(Singapore)) near the [mouth](/wiki/River_mouth) of the [Singapore River](/wiki/Singapore_River). ## Architecture The Dalhousie Obelisk is an important [architectural](/wiki/Architectural) element in [Empress Place](/wiki/Empress_Place_Building) but somewhat neglected and obscured by [trees](/wiki/Tree). It was designed by [John Turnbull Thomson](/wiki/John_Turnbull_Thomson) when he was a Government [Surveyor](/wiki/Surveyor_(surveying)). He was obviously inspired by "[Cleopatra's Needle](/wiki/Cleopatra%27s_Needle_(London))" on the [Thames Embankment](/wiki/Thames_Embankment) in [London](/wiki/London). - National Heritage Board (2002), *Singapore's 100 Historic Places*, Archipelago Press, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 981-4068-23-3 - Norman Edwards, Peter Keys (1996), *Singapore - A Guide to Buildings, Streets, Places*, Times Books International, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9971-65-231-5 - Virtual Reality view of Dalhousie Obelisk - Uniquely Singapore website Archived 2006-01-11 at the [Wayback Machine](/wiki/Wayback_Machine)
title: Dalhousie Obelisk
